creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: fourteen total lines: eleven full lines of cursive; tenth line, and bottom of eleventh line angle off towards the LL; twelfth line consists of 1-2 connected characters at center of page; last two lines at L are bold and have slightly larger characters; paper has seam just L of center
title: Twenty-five Letters
